channel.title: Causality on Ziwei's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Causality on Ziwei's Site

item.title: Approximate Causal Effect Identification under Weak Confounding
item.description: Overview In this project, We aimed to investigate the relationship between the influence of unobserved confounders and the deviation of spurious correlation from the true causal effect. This is similar to the concept of sensitivity analysis in the causal effect estimation. We utilized entropy as a measure to quantify the strength of the confounder and developed an algorithm to estimate bounds for the causal effect based on the observational distribution and the strength of confounders.
